text: THE MOON. So fat and full in the night sky you can reach and touch it. HICKS W. 0. This is what's known: There has always been man...and there have always been vampires. BLACK SHAPES swoop past the moonscape, vicious looking th Much shrieking and wailing. Atop a STONE ZIGGURAT -- We see a GROUP OF MEN -- AZTEC WARRIORS readying themselves with PRIMITIVE WEAPONS -- SLINGS, BOWS, SPEARS. Tonight they know they will die.

Since the beginning -- the two have been locked forever in combat... The vampires were quicker, stronger and had the gift of flight. Quick glimpses of a bloody, brutal battle. Men screaming. Talons ripping. FIERY ARROWS launched against an unseen e
With a HOWL, we see A MAN plucked off the ground, his bod disappearing in the night. THE IMAGE DISSOLVES as -- the turns bright, the moon becoming a familiar ball of yellow

But man had the sun. THE CAMERA TILTS DOWN to find another GROUP OF MEN -- mor sophisticated than the first. Makeshift weapons made of m and steel slung across their backs glinting in the sunlig They stand before AN EARTHEN STRUCTURE, looks like a GIAN NEST. Unsheathing their weapons, they step grimly inside. We HEAR a HISSING WAIL and the wielding of steel.

And so it went like this over many years. As man and vampire both evolved -- the wars became bloodier. From afar, we see GIANT STACKS OF CORPSES as hydraulic machines stack the black bodies into pyres as big as buildings, smoke rising to the sky in twisting columns.
Stands at the base of one of the mammoth pyres. Even from this angle we sens e his quiet dignity.
Then came THE PRIESTS -- The Man turns and we see his face is shadowed by a large CROSS TATTOO, cutting across his eyes and down the center

-- Specially trained warriors in the art of vampire combat. They single-handedly turned the tide for the humans. Quick glimpses of a GROUP OF PRIESTS battling a FURY OF VAMPIRES (we still do not get a good look at them). Their technique is otherworldy -- combining the brutality of a Maori Warrior. with the grace of a Samurai. The--combat-is intense. Glorious. An explosion of blood a s b m i l

Over time the vampire threat faded. The once fierce race now fatally diminished. A shadow of what they once. were. Through heavy smoke, we see a pile of VAMPIRE CORPSES, a ragged collection of fangs and claws.

The remaining vampires were put Into camps and -- by decree of the High Clergy the Priests disbanded. The former warriors to be integrated as members of regular society. We see a WAX SEAL pressed onto an ancient parchment. The document carefully rolled and stored in an ORNATE CHAMBER
The human race thrived in relative quiet. The vampire menace quickly forgotten for other, more modern threats.

And the few surviving Priests faded Into quiet obscurity. The chamber is closed. We see an encrusted key turning in heavy set lock and we -- FADE TO BLACK. .s. Our story begins with the rusty SCRAPE of a windmill...

Dust swirls in nasty tangles. A LONE MALE FIGURE moves across the plain, long and lean overalls. AARON PACE. Shadows flicker across his sunburne face, the windmill looming above him. in his hands is an ELECTRONIC DEVICE, he plunges it into earth. It makes a series of CLICKING SOUNDS, reading the Aaron looks up to see the silhouette of a WOMAN standing the doorway of his CABIN. He smiles, waving to her. His wife.
A pioneer's wood cabin. Aaron sits surrounded, a lattice work of vines covering t walls and floors in beautiful patterns. Not a trace of so anywhere in the room, everything hydroponically grown.
Supper's on! He smiles, studying a. stunning RUBY RED FLOWER, separate the others. His crown jewel. He closes the door and enter
SHANNON PACE carries a bowl filled with a steaming green broth, placing it on the dinner table, moving aside a tin FIGURINE OF JESUS. The surrounding furniture cluttered wi religious knickknacks.
You been spending an awful lot of time behind that door. Makes a woman suspicious.
Special project. It's taking a little more time than I thought.
Nothing special about milkweed. Unless you like a thorn in the finger. 4.
It's not Milkweed. Not this year.
What is it?
You'll see. His eyes skate to her face moving in for the kiss -- but
Yuck. Pershing-stew again. Their DAUGHTER (13). Already a heartbreaker. This girl is too young, too pretty to be out here in the badlands.
I can't do it anymore. This outpost. Being all cooped up like this. I'm going
Honey...we know this hasn't been easy for you -- In two years someone else'll study the soil and this'll be their outpost. But for right now -- this is my job.
I don't know what it's like to have a best friend. To have any friends. I want to have a crush. I want secrets.
I want a life. Shannon looks at her husband. She knew this day would com
Aaron. She's thirteen -- She should be with children her own age. Aaron lets out a breath.
Okay. Next year, we'll figure out a way to get you to a school close by. In town.
N year -- that's still plenty of time for you to have a "crush". Lucy deflates, knowing this is as good as it's going to g for awhile. Aaron takes her hand.
Tomorrow I'm heading in town to file. You come with, help your old man out, get a change of scenery. OK?
Now c'mon, stew's getting cold. Bow your heads and say grace. The family clasps hands. Whatever their differences, ther a bond here.
Dear Lord we thank you for what we are about to receive. Blessing us with your gifts... She.speaks with her eyes clenched shut, words spoken sincerely, nothing perfunctory about it. She's a believer
We thank you for the earth and the sky and for your bounty through Christ our Lord -- She.stops, opening her eyes -- staring at the plates and glasses on the table. They're RATTLING.
Daddy?
Shh. He cocks his ear, heading a low rumble. Although he's never heard the sound before...he knows it only mean one thing. Trying to remain calm, Aaron goes to the window.

Framed by a BLOOD MOON hanging over the horizon, a DOZEN MOTORCYCLES race across the plain, ENGINES thundering. 6. The Jesus figurine falls off the table, SHATTERING to the floor. Aaron looks at Shannon, an expression on his face she has seen before -
Get the boards)
What's going on? Aaron doesn't answer, Shannon helping him position pre-cu planks across every window and door. Each with an iron-cr strut for support
The CYCLES circle the house, kicking up dust in sheets.
The ROAR of the engines fills the house as Aaron pulls a POWERFUL LOOKING GUN from the drawer. He drops it, obviou not familiar with firearms.
Get by me. Shannon-and Lucy crouch at his feet.

The cycles cut their engines, headlights centered on the house. A blistering spotlight. It's quiet. The RIDERS step from their machines. We don't get a look their faces as one by one they LEAP onto the house and windmill, SKITTERING across the walls and roof like spide The blades of the windmill slowly come to a stop. 11U. OUTPOST 10 r- SAME The power goes out, everything going black.

Daddy? 7. We hear the Riders crawling over the outside of the house Snarling, howling, making terrifying sounds. Then the worst sound of all. Wood being torn apart. BLAM! BLAN! Aaron SHOOTS like crazy, the white light MUZZ FLASHES providing glimpses of SHAPES moving inside the ho BLACK BODIES blown back. Shrieking. Everything happening lightening fast. Finally, the gun clicks empty and we're plunged back into darkness.
Aaron is still standing, the house in shambles around him He's alone.
From outside we hear the cycles revving. Aaron runs to the door. Rips off the board in time to see
The motorcycles racing away, a cloud of dust in their wak Aaron runs after but TRIPS on --
Her body lying in the dirt, head lurching at an obscene' angle. He brushes back her hair -- ere' g UNCT_URE MABKS in hem neck. Crying, he cradles his, wife. Feverishly looking around f

He keeps screaming but it's no use -- as the-motorcycles in the night he knows -- They've taken her. The CAMERA TILTS to the MOON hanging above the plain. it turns BLACK as we now find ourselves peering into -- 8.
The lip of an ENORMOUS SMOKESTACK. One of hundreds. A seemingly endless brick forest reaching to a sky heavy wi soot and ash, while below, miles of FACTORIES stretch and stretch.
Quitting time. Hundreds of WORKERS trail listlessly from massive brick and stone COMPLEX. Grey faces betraying another day's toll.

moves through the crowd, people stepping out of his way. They do this not out of respect. . .but fear. We don't get a good look at him. Just FLASHES -- Shaved head. Eyes like nail guns. Tendons clenching over muscle. As he walks,people whisper. He hears all of it. He heads into the streets. CITIZENS hurry by, some with. surgical masks over their mouths. There's a pale, sicklin to them. Malignant. The Figure suddenly stops. He cocks his bald head -- Something's caught his attention...
We move through trash and shadow finding -- A gang of FACTORY WORKERS, uniformed, surrounding a GIRL (12). Their LEADER holds her close, BUTCHER KNIFE at her throat. Mouth at her ear.
Go ahead ...scream.
Scream for daddy. He hears a noise, looks up and sees a SILHOUETTE standing the head of the alley. 9.

Looks like daddy's already here. (points the knife) Well, then. Come on daddy...make it better. The Figure steps into a pool of white light, giving us ou first good look at him -- A LAL RGE AK CROSS TATTOO shadows most of his-- a e. Acro the eyes and down the center. The Mark Of The Priest.
A Priest! Well, lookie here.. We got us a real life war-hero boysl Heard you guys were real baddasses. The Workers all pull out large knives.
Guess we'll find out. They move in on Priest, chemicals burning in their blood, mouths leering. Priest folds his hands into the prayer position. The Workers look at each other. Laugh.

What's he gonna do. . .BLESS us to death? VOOMI -- There's a whirling SNARL of sound -- the sonic equivalent of a back flip and -- Pries is holding their knives. Before they can react, he throws the knives into their fe They HOWL, pinned to the concrete. Scared, the leader clutches the girl, pressing against th brick wall as Priest moves towards him.
This ain't the war no more. You got no right meddlin'.
You don't belong here -- You ain't one of us. 10. And with that he RAISES the blade to the girl's throat --

WHOOSHI A sudden RUSH OF AIR. The leader looks at the girl's neck, his blade's gone. So is his hand. Priest holds the severed limb, its fingers still clutchin the blade. The Leader collapses, a Holy Shitl expression frozen on his face.

Gawks at Priest, possibly more frightened of him than the workers. He turns to her, wanting to comfort her but not knowing h She flinches and runs away, disappearing into the street. A BEAT as Priest pries the butcher blade from the hand, wiping it off. Tucks it in his waistband. He moves on.
Gone to seed. The once proud house of God now a sad collection of moldering stone and cracked stained glass.
PUSH past row after row of empty pews. We stop on the CONFESSIONAL BOOTH -- a foot sticking out the door --
FATHER KOEPPEN, body skinny and ravaged. The old man pour himself a drink and downs it. Coughing. The confessional door opens, someone steps inside the oth booth. We can't see who it is.
Bless me Father for I have sinned...again. The voice is like gravel from the bottom of a deep well. Quietly commanding. Koeppen knows it well. 11.
I caught the ambulance picking up what was left of the factory boys...figured it was your handywork. The Shape leans forward, we see it is Priest.
This time there was a little girl.
if this keeps occurring it'll be .impossible to keep it from the Clergy. You'll get us both excommunicated. Priest gazes into the vestibule, his voice almost a whisp
I want to see the other Priests.
You know you can't. The Clergy forbids it.
Why?
They have their reasons. Priest flicks his eyes over Koeppen as if he could see through the vestibule, but his expression doesn't change.
And their reasons for building more and more factories? The sky is turning black.
Since when is. industriousness a sin? Did Jesus not teach us to be productive?
As your appointed counselor take my advice, . .Relax -- Take up a hobby, pick a vice. Make friends.
You're my friend.
I'm a wicked old man who'd sell his parish for a pint of whiskey. Priest seems to deflate, his hard shell cracking. 12.
I don't know what's happening to me. (7, Questions. Doubts. I'm not sure what it is. Koeppen slides the vestibule open so they are now face to
The devil comes in many shapes. Do yourself a favor, keep your head down. Be smart. And most of all remember your oath... He hands Priest a set of ROSARY BEADS.

"To go against the Church is to go against God". This statement has always been the boilerplate of Priest' existence -- but tonight, it Just sounds like empty dogma squeezes his eyes shut, clutching the,rosary as we CUT TO

Garbage litters the floor. The sound of water dripping. Priest stands, waiting for the lift to arrive. A BOY AND HIS MOTHER wait too. The boy stares at Priest, fascinated, his mother doing her best to pretend not to notice him. The elevator arrives and they step inside.
As it rises, a single bulb flickers above. Buzzing. The boy continues to stare at Priest, bewitched by the ta
Did it hurt? The lift grinds to a stop. The mother quickly pulls her s out as the door rolls open, glaring at Priest, disappeari down a dark corridor. And only now does Priest answer. 13.
Yes. The lift door clatters shut.

Sparse, containing only what's needed. Priest peels off his shirt revealing a constellation of o battle scars -- Punctures. Scratches. Bite marks. His ski showing the early signs of aging. He goes to the lone decoration in his apartment --

head_text.subj: A FADED PHOTO OF THE PACE FAMILY

text: He takes the picture off the wall, studying it. The image bringing him peace. From the streets below, the sound of a GUNSHOT. He looks at the rosary beads, still in his hand. He turns out the light.
Unable to sleep, Priest sits on the edge of his bed. Pray There's a knock at the door.
Who is it?
Messenger. Priest opens the door. A MESSENGER holds up a PUNCH CARD.
I gota Priority Punch. Originated in the wasteland. Priest takes the card, the man writing up a receipt. 14.

Priest goes to a WOODEN BOX, feeding the punch card into A Rube Goldberg-like device of PULLEYS and WINCHES squeak life, like a sail, a SCREEN rises and Aaron appears, his a smudge. He looks awful. A man at the end of himself.
L-Lucy's gone. They t-took her. I tried to stop 'em. I knowouu're..."retired". But can you find her? Find her before --.
They killed Shannon. The screen goes blank. Priest shuts his eyes, making the sign of the cross. His hand curls into a fist.
Magnificent. At the Cities center, a municipal of baroque BASILICAS AN .CHURCHES -- all safely walled off from the rest of the metropolis.

Giant shafts of moonlight hit a marbled floor. Priest and Father Koeppen are led by FOUR OFFICERS before TRIBUNAL OF MONSIGNORS (all at least in their 70's). They sit behind a giant table cloaked in the florid robes of t religion. Men of scripture, creed and doctrine. Priest kneels, bowing his head.
Thank you for meeting with me on such short notice, Monsignors. Even the Monsignors are uneasy'around Priest. Their leade ORELAS, leans forward, addressing him.
Father Koeppen notified us of the situation. Our prayers are with your family. 15.
I come before you because I would like my authority to be reinstated.
On what grounds? Priest is taken aback.
She's my blood, Monsignor.
The proper authorities are handling the situation. I'm sure they'll.do a fine job.
The proper authorities?
All occurrences of vampire. disobedience and felonies are strictly a Federal matter now.
You Priests did too good a job. The vampire population is classified as endangered. They're protected.
But Monsignor...they are the enemy.
Were.the enemy. The war ended a long time ago.
Not so long that we should forget what they are capable of.
You would do well to remember the words of our Savior: Turn the other cheek. Embrace your enemies.
It is not our place to interfere --- or yours. Priest looks up, obviously in great turmoil.
I can be of.great service to the investigation. I -can 16. 0 The tribunal shifts uncomfortably, intimidated by Pries Orelas stands.
You forget yourself, Priest... It has been brought to our attention that you have engaged in a number of transgressions. Tell me...do you feel yourself to be above God?
No, Monsignor.
Engaging in any kind of practice is sacrilege -- You bring shame upon our house. Priest turns the full force of his gaze on him.
"Let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father which is in Heaven" --
The Monsignor POUNDS the table.

You dare quote scripture to met Questioning the . authority. of the Clergy is forbidden1 If you engage in another transgression.you will be stripped from the Order and excommunicated immediately. Do I make myself clear?
Yes, sir.'
I said do I make myself clear,. Father.
Yes, Monsignor.
You're a soldier. God's soldier-- Act like one.
Remember your vow: "To go against the Church is to go against God". 0
The officers start to lead Priest and Koeppen out the cha 17.
-- Eather..Kam, please stay behind for a moment, a .we have something we need to discuss. Off Koeppen's expression we CUT TO:
HOMELESS stand single file, wrapped around the corner, bl flakes of ash drifting down as they await tonight's suppe
Priest sits alone, rosary beads clutched in his hands. He looks up to find Koeppen, the old man staggering as he do an EXPENSIVE BOTTLE OF WHISKEY, three sheets to the wind. KOEPPEN
I knew I'd find you here. He sits, pouring himself another drink, toasting the poor souls at the surrounding tables. KOEPPEN (CONT'D)
How many nights in this very spot? You with your endless questions on the nature of suffering-Me with none of the answers. Priest doesn't even acknowledge him, lost in his thoughts KOEPPEN (CONT'D)
Well, now I'm the one with a question. This one's a riddle. (BEAT)
What is greater than God-but more evil than the Devil? The poor have it, the rich need it -- and if you eat it...you'll die. Priest looks, up, his eyes cold. PRIEST
Why won't they listen to me? A beat. Koeppen takes another drink. KOEPPEN
Okay. I'm going to.give you one more riddle and if you listen close - you might just hear an answer to your question. (clears his throat) (MORE)
KOEPPEN (CONT'D)

How can a man who spent his whole life searching for devils miss the ones staring him in the face? From behind, a CLICKING sound. Priest turns to find an OFFICER standing, LASER-GUIDED SHOTGUN pointed at him. The soup kitchen suddenly deathly quiet. KOEPPEN (CONT'D)
The Church feels it's better to keep you under its care...at least until this trouble with your niece blows over.. PRIEST
You know I can't do that. KOEPPEN
That's what I figured.

head_text.subj: TEN TROOPERS IN FULL RIOT GEAR STORM IN

text: Jackboots CLACKING, they form a circle around Priest and Koeppen. Guns SNAP into place, laser points dotting his b Priest looks at Koeppen -- betrayed. PRIEST
Why? KOEPPEN (TOASTING RUEFULLY)
"To go against the Church is to go against God'. Priest looks around the room -- FAMILIES AND HOMELESS hud at the surrounding tables, terrified. There's only one thing left for him to do. PRIEST

Then ...I go against God. In an eyeblink -- Priest strips the gun from the nearby officer, CRACKING i against the trooper's head, his attack graceful and preci a whirlwind of PINPOINTED BLOWS and SHATTERED BONES. When it's over, eleven troopers lie on the ground writhin Everything goes quiet. 19.
He breaks, from his father.'' knee, slowly moving towards window, drawn by a FLICKERING SHADOW. His mouth drops open as --
PUNCH through the windows in unison, showering everybody glass! BULLETS whistle through the air, everyone SCREAMIN as they scramble for cover. The father diving for his son PRIEST
Folds his hands into the prayer position. VOONI There's a POP OF AIR and --- ' SILENCE
The: troopers look around confused -- their guns have disappeared.
A neat pile of shotguns sit, every FIRED BULLET collected harmlessly in a clean circle around them ...as if picked of thin air.
is somehow back with his father, the two safely holding hands, staring stupidly at each other. Priest is gone. KOEPPE4
Looks at his fancy whiskey bottle, inside now floats Prie ROSARY BEADS. He fishes them from the bottle, hand shakin KOEPPEN
Heaven help us. He takes a swig. CUT TO:
The STRIKE of a match -- a prayer candle is lit, glowing the darkness. 20.
Priest kneels, eyes clenched shut in prayer. A large figurine of Jesus on the cross looms over him. The Christ expressive -- He suffers. PRIEST
oh my God...I am sorry for. having offended you. it was never my intention to do so... His words continue OVER
Priest standing in front of a STEEL DOOR. Hasn't been ope for some time.
I want so much to firmly resolve with the help of your grace to sin no more and to .avoid the near occasions of sin.
The DOOR slides open just a crack. A sliver of light land on a piece of BLACK SCULPTED METAL.
But I can't.
An ENGINE ROARS, RUMBLES, idling... a throaty GURGLE... P pulls out on a BLACK MOTORCYCLE
if this thing were a horse it'd be the ultimate stallion- Pulse engine. Nitrous. The works. A panel of black titani solar cells covers the bike like armor. He races onto the street.
Sheets of rain fall like lead. Pooling in the gutters.

All I can do is ask for forgiveness for what is yet to come... 21. The cycle knifes through the city. Expertly working his w through congested streets. Moving past tent cities, stockyards and rusty industrial machinery.
We see a MASSIVE WALL -- A hundred feet high, surrounding city. Priest pulls up to a CHECKPOINT TOWER. A PHALANX OF GUARDS with big shotguns at the ready, snapping into plac Mugs like anvils.
I now know the devil lives within me. The sins coming all too easy... Still on his bike, Priest's foot touches the ground, bloc our view as we CUT TO:
THE MASSIVE DOOR/WALL sliding open with a KLANG1 revealin the wasteland.
And all too frequently. Priest REVS his bike, gunning out the doors. UNCONSCIOUS BODIES left in his wake. CUT TO:
Blazing sun. An endless plain of cracked earth. Nothing around anywhere... VROOMI
Priest's cycle streaks across the salt flats. It's glorio

Priest rides past a line of ANCIENT STATUES dominating th landscape, each representing one of the seven deadly sins sentinels marking the boundary into the deep wasteland. He FLOORS it, the bike PUNCHING for the horizon, a thick of dust funneling behind it... CUT TO:

It's quiet, Just the sound of the rusty windmill. The onl light provided by the moon reflecting off Priest's cycle, he's just arrived. He crouches, examining,a fresh TIRE TREAD. He stares, tak the landscap e, feeling it. Then he steps inside the cabin --

It looks like a war zone. Splintered furniture everywhere sprays of dried, black blood over the floorboards. He brushes away rubble and finds a DRESS, Shannon's. Putt his face to it, he inhales, his expression softening. BEHIND HIM
Quietly, A COWBOY HAT and a SHOTGUN BARREL emerge from a in the floor. COWBOY HAT
Alright, now -- Not another step. Climbing out from the hole, both barrels pointed, is SHER HICKS (22). You could say the name fits. But you'd only b half right. HICKS
Thought you'd come back for a souvenir, hub? You gotta be the dumbest bloodsucker I ever come across. Priest steps into a pool of moonlight, illuminating his f PRIEST
If I was a vampire you'd be dead already. The cross tattoo, a striking image. Hicks stares, pushing his hat back on his forehead. HICKS
I'll be dammed. He casually spits some ATOMIC CHAW, hitting the floorboar with a SIZZLE. CUT TO:
Hicks and Priest ride in tandem across the plain. Hicks' bike a standard police vehicle, nothing fancy but reliabl They head towards town, passing aWOODEN SIGN`-- HALBRIDGE

At a glance this seems like one of those frontier towns f an old western. TOWNSPEOPLE gather around a SNAKE-OIL SALESMAN, the man pitching his wares before a painted van reading DR. TOMLI MEDICINE SHOW. TRANCE MUSIC wafts from the nearby saloon.
Do I ask for three dollars?' Do I ask for two dollars? No folks! ONE dollar! One piece of tin and protection is yours!
Pull up in front of the Jail. Hicks eyes the salesman, coolly dismounts and adjusts his hat. HICKS
aScuse me a minute, He heads towards the crowd, the salesman continuing his p
Vampires are a deadly lot! YOU could be next I I seen a Blackblood bite a man like a gingersnap! The only sure way to be safe is a bag of DR. TOMLIN' S WONDER POWDERT

(holds up a sack) If you care about your loved ones then you MUST have this amazing elixir in your homes tonight -- WHOOSH! A KNIFE slices through the air, spears the sack a pins it to a nearby wall with a THUNK. Hicks steps to the front of the crowd. it's his knife. HICKS
You best get in that van and clear on out, mister. 24.
For what reasons? I'm a legitimate business man. Hicks PULLS his SIX-SHOOTER, cocks it. HICKS
I got six right here.
Sheriff, I am shocked you can be.so cavalier with the safety of your TOWNFOLK --
HAM! A bullet blows out the van's headlight. HICKS
That's one. KAPOW! The windshield cracks like a spiderweb. HICKS (CONT'D)

Two. Immediately, the salesman quickly packs up his wares, scrambling for the van door. As he gets in, he catches a look at Priest, pauses a moment, then starts up the vehic and quickly PEELS away. Hicks pulls the knife from the wall, holds the bag up to crowd. HICKS (CONT'D)

Now you all listen up. This bag ain't good fornothin' but linin' that man's pockets with your hard earned money. Much shuffling amongst the people -- they trust in their sheriff but they're frightened. An older man named, CROCK steps up. CROCKER
You don't know'that. You're just a kid. HICKS
I seen enough two-bit hustlers and carry barkers. He ain't no better. CROCKER
But what if he's right? Hicks tosses the sack to Crocker. 25. HICKS
Take a look. (Crocker does, the contents spilling to the ground) Ain't nothin' but sand, flour and maybe 'a little garlic.. Oldest trick in the WASTELAND: (TO EVERYONE)
Now I don't blame you for bein' afraid. But those vampires headed clear .on out and they ain't comin' back. WOMAN
And what about the girl? Hicks pauses. This is not easily said. HICKS

I filed a report with the Cities last night. I'm sure they're Join' all they can. The townspeople mutter amongst themselves. Hicks looks ov to Priest, a GROUP OF CHILDREN have already gathered,. pointing and whispering at him.
A hole in the wall. A few wanted posters and postal warra tacked up on a board beside asingle jail cell. Hicks leads Priest inside. HICKS

I've already had one of the boys send for your brother. We got him put up at Paddy's place. Priest gazes out . the; window. A group of TOWNSPEOPLE ar milling out front, staring at him.. He pulls down the sha

You're gonna have to excuse the attention.. We don't get strangers `round here too much -- "Specially no Priest. 'Course we ain't never had no vampire attack in.these parts before. (eyeing Priest.) But then you're just here to perform the service, right? Priest doesn't reply, staring at a yellowed wanted poster 26. HICKS (CONT'D)
Never much of a believer myself. I figure I got one bullet to shoot. I'm gonna shoot it my way... not how some BOOK tells me to. (SPITS)
But I do hear things...it true what they may about you folks? (BEAT)
You can fold time? At that, Priest turns, looking at Hicks. Before he can answer the door opens and -- AARON
comes through, looking older than the last time we saw hi Seeing Priest, his face cracks, smiling for the first tim days. AARON
You came. Overcome, he wraps his arms around his brother, embracing him. Priest hugs him back.

A BLIND GRAVEDIGGER plays an old.SQQUEEZEBOX, hands exper working the bellows. He's done this for every.,funeral in Halbridge for the last fifty years. The sad music drifts across the wasteland. SHANNON'S COFFIN

Lies in a freshly dug hole. Priest sprinkles dirt across. casket, offering prayers. Aaron watches,. silently. A GROUP OF TOWNSPEOPLE encircle grave. Everyone wearing black goggles for protection from the swirling dust. HICKS

Stands apart from the others, hat in his hands. His eyes focused on Priest. Not even watching as -- Aaron plants the RUBY RED FLOWER at the head of the grave Its glorious color almost obscene in this barren wastelan CUT TO:

A DOG rests lazily in front of a rotating fan. PADDY'S a bear of a man, the town bachelor. He plops down bowls of brown stew before a waiting and hungry Aaron and Priest, The gruel smells foul, tastes fouler. PADDY

Jackrabbit Stew. Never served no man of the cloth before. Hope you like it spicy, Father! He stands over both of them, eager for a response. Priest takes a sip, grimaces, tries his best to smile but fails hideously. PRIEST
.Delicious PADDY
(slaps him on the back) `Course it isl it was me Ma's recipe. As Paddy jubilantly walks away, Priest puts the bowl on t floor and the dog pads over, eagerly lapping it up. Aaron smiles. AARON
How come you never came round more? You know you were always welcome. PRIEST
I know. AARON

After the war was over we figured you'd stay with us. Shannon was real fond of you. Lucy too. She was always asking about you. Uncomfortable with the conversation, Priest pulls out a m unrolling it onto the wooden table. He moves his finger across the paper. PRIEST
The pack headed in this direction. There's a reservation up that way so that's where I'll start. AARON
if anyone finds out you're doing this -- 28. o r PRIEST You're my brother. Aaron nods. This is enough,

Beautiful place. Wonder of the world. I used to watch `em every night, takin' to the sky in all of God's glory, (LEANS FORWARD)

I never would disturb `em though. God's children like their privacy. He winks, smiling that crazy smile. Priest considers the possibility of a lead here -- but Hicks just gazes at the man like he's nuts as we CUT TO:
The boys mounting up their bikes, about to head out. The approaches Priest. OLD MAN
Wait! I want you to have somethin' before you go He presses a HOMEMADE CROSS into Priest's hand. It's a re beauty, flecked with colored stones. A lot of love and ca went into this one. 54.

Remember, a man comes into this world with one thing. His soul. He's lucky if he's still got it when he leaves. Yep. Truly a wonder of the world...good thing we listened to the fossil. Don't know how we'd find Lucy without him. PRIEST
Vampires sometimes use abandoned structures as a perch. (looks at Hicks) Watch for booby traps. And with that he enters the--
Desert shrubs sprout like weeds between the stones, once proud turrets rotting to dust, everything bleached by the weather. Whatever this place was -- the desert owns it no HICKS
Why we listen' to that crackpot? Crazy fucker's so blinded by faith he's batahit. That's called a zealot in my. book. (BEAT)

I'm startin' to think you might be one yourself. You ever think bout that? Priest doesn't respond, squinting his eyes. At the opposite end of the courtyard is an opening. It leads into a CHAMBER of some kind.
Musty. Cool. Dark. Walls rising high into a cone as sunlight streams in from an opening in the top. Hicks and Priest enter, stepping carefully over PILES OF (GARBAGE littering the floor. HICKS

This is bullshit. Lucy's been gone five days'-- every stupid minute we waste here is a minute more she gets farther-away. Priest turns and sees a STONE STAIRCASE, uneven steps lea downwards...too dark to tell where though. 56. PRIEST
Stay here. If anything comes up the steps that isn't me -- Shoot it. Before Hicks can reply,.Priest heads down the stairs, dar swallowing him with every step. HICKS
Great.
The air seems thicker here, the darkness claustrophobic. Enveloping. It takes a moment for Priests' eyes to adjust A CATACOMB
Actually more a cave. Miles and miles. Twisting, jagged a moist. Endless corners, weaving into a dark and hideous m Priest heads into it
Frustrated, Hicks kicks at the garbage. There's something underneath. He brushes aside the refuse, uncovering a . bunch' of SMA WHITE SHAPES, breath catching as he realizes what it is: Bones.
It's quiet. Priest moves through the darkness, footsteps not even a whisper, heading deeper and deeper into the labyrinth as

Hicks is now at the chamber wall,'running his hand along feels grooves lining its surface. Stepping back, he sees they form an image-of some kind. H to make it out in the darkness. He leafs through the garbage, pulling out a piece of BROK GLASS AS

Priest turns a jagged corner and looks down the longest, narrow tunnel yet. A light shines at the end. A TORCH. Flickering gently. A SHADOW brushes past the light, moving so fast it barely registers. Could just be a trick of the eye. Or not. Priest moves towards it.
Hicks angles the broken glass under the light, reflecting faint beam onto the wall, revealing a HUGE CARVING cut in THE STONE:
1L0Z.J.PIf .! i Primitive but very creepy. We linger on the image, the terror of the people, the viciousness of the creature. Tr horrific.

Quiet. Just the low how], of a breeze moving through the tunnel. Priest walks into an ANIMAL PEN of sorts, a hay-like substance covering the floor, the smell of something best He,covers his nose, looking around, something in the corn catching his eye --- TWO BODIES
splayed across the ground like rag dolls. He crouches to take a closer look...

SOMETHING. barrels into him with superhuman force! Acting on instinct, Priest FOLDS AND ROLLS. Kicking the thing off him and PUSHING off the wall for a blistering recovery. Whatever it is, it's fast. Quickly countering for every m he gives, neither able to get the upper hand. Too dark to make out what it is. Priest locks his arms around the shape's arms, SLAb24=G i against the wall, illuminating it under the torch light.

o A BEAT as they stand staring at each other, unsure what say. The cross tattoo covers her face, shadowing fierce eyes. Every inch a warrior. Time seems to stop for these two. Their whole dark histor their bend -- passing between them in one glance. PRIESTESS
How did you find me? Priest doesn't reply. She narrows her eyes, suspicious. PRIESTESS (CONT'D)
Did the Clergy send you? PRIEST
No. (BEAT)
Why would they? She nods towards the bodies, we now see tb=1re.-VAMPIRZ- CORPSES. PRIESTESS
I've been busy. Off Priest's reaction we CUT TO:
Hicks looking up to see the light; from the hole in the geilingwinkinc_out. The sun is setting. Slipping, he drops the piece og glass, cutting his finger Drawing blood. HICKS
Shit. He wipes the blood on his pants, not noticing as a A LARG SHAPE looms in the archway behind him...
The two warriors eye each other, the. air heavy between t PRIESTESS
If you didn't come for me...why are you here? PRIEST
I should be asking you the same question. 59. The bestial smell stings their nostrils, smells good. PRIESTESS
There's another one around here somewhere. PRIEST
Where? PRIESTESS
I don't know...but it's not like the others. They're interrupted by the sound of GUNFIRE echoing off t tunnel walls. Priest turns. PRIEST
Hicks. He starts down the tunnel. The Priestess quickly followin
Hicks is sprawled at the base of the stairs, bloodied and bruised. Both guns pointed at
SOMETHING is lurking. A hulking shadow, sounds like a rab bull. We catch the TIP OF A CLAW scraping at the stone fl Priest approaches from down the tunnel, senses on full al PRIEST
It's too big to fit down here. That's why you're still alive. HICKS
What the hell is that thing?I HICKS
I'm not stupid. Vampires don't look like that.
They used to. The Priestess steps out from behind Priest. Startling Hic 60. HICKS
Who the hell are you?! (7, She doesn't even bother to respond,.just shooting a look the two warriors bound
Charging into battle. Priest BURSTS from the stairway LEAPING up and over as the Priestess rolls off to the sid He-lands beside her, the two turning to face down -- THE VAMPIRE

A fearsome creature -- much more terrifying than the Nightshade variety. Bigger, more ferocious. The ancient cousin to the more modern vampire. The beast opens its mouth and lets loose with a SCREAM, i breath vile. THE PRIESTS
Split up. The Priestess LEAPING to the stone wall and climbing up the rock. Priest goes the opposite way, ROLLI across the floor, keeping low. I THE VAMPIRE
With a screech, goes for the Priestess. Crawling up the w hunched like a rat, talons ferociously . digging, into: r Coordinating an attack wordlessly, the Priests make their THE PRIESTESS
Lets go of the wall, PLUMMETING straight towards the vamp the creature FLASHING its fangs in anticipation. PRIEST

Leaps from below, darting up the rock, taking advantage o the distraction, landing on the creature's back and wrapp his arms around its neck. Going for the deathlock. With a SHRIEK the creature WHIPS its head with crack forc sending Priest flying. The Priestess, still in mid-drop, CATCHES him and they both hit the ground with their feet. PRIESTESS
Should we lead it into open air? More room to. maneuver. 61. PRIEST

Better to keep it contained. The vampire's lathered into an animal frenzy now, wailing scuttling around the circular wall in crazy patterns. Suddenly -- with a stone shattering BOOM! it BURSTS throu the hole, FLYING out into the night. PRIESTESS
Or not. They race outside.
The Priests look up to find the vampire clawed around a turret, shadowed in the moonlight. WHOOSH!. Great leathery wings unfold from its back as it SWOOPS low, coming in for the'kill. PRIEST
Darts behind a boulder just in time. The creature's talon SCRAPING at the rock before it soars back to the sky, He pulls out his bible, grabbing and tossing a handful of THROWING CROSSES

CUTTING through the air, sparkling in the moonlight, beautiful. BUT They BOUNCE harmlessly off the creature's wings, knifing to the ground, imbedding deep in the stone, Priest having nimbly: dodge his own weaponry. THE CREATURE HOWLS! Blazing straight for him. Undaunted. Priest looks at the Priestess and folds his ha into the prayer position, leveling his breath, pulse slow as the screaming beast bares down like a freight train! THE PRIESTESS

Quickly scoops up TWO LARGE ROCKS -- HURTLING them toward the vampire. HER EYES LOCK WITH PRIEST'S as she too folds her hand, into the prayer position. RY azNG GOES BLACK Silence. Then -- 62. The sound of a heartbeat. The juncture between instants. A fissure. A BRIGHT FLASH -- we see Priest LEAPING through the air - EVERYTHING AROUND HIM FROZEN -- the creature, the rocks, Priestess.
A BRIGHT FLASH again -- and now Priest is using the froze rocks as STEPS -- LAUNCHING his body until he is above th CREATURE --

i121i12_ M, .Q A BRIGHT FLASH again -- and now Priest is ON the behemoth pulls out the FAMILIAR'S KNIFE, twirling it in his hand - EVERYTHING GOES BLACx And WHAM1 we fuse back into real time as the creature CRA to the ground. Its DECAPITATED HEAD rolling to a stop, fa frozen in a horrible rictus. A BEAT O
as the world seems to hold its breath then -- Priest lands in a crouch, dropping next to the Priestess, hands still locked in the prayer position. She turns to h PRIESTESS
Not bad. Suddenly the CREATURE'S BODY erupts into ablistering deat spasm! Talons clacking like STRAIGHT RAZORS, flailing dangerously close to the two of them. BAMI
A single bullet. pierces its heart and the body collapses a THUD. Once and for all -- dead. ANGLE ON HICKS in the archway, smoke coming off his gun. looks at the Priests. HICKS
Point A...meet point fuckin' B. He smiles, twirling his six shooters back into their hols CUT TO:
Hicks examining the fallen creature, poking at the carcas with his gun. In some crazy, distant way he's related to this thing. He raises his hand, comparing it to the beast's talon. Shakes his head.
Priest and the Priestess stare out at the Wasteland, uncomfortable with looking at each other. PRIEST
This was a Pureblood. PRIESTESS
we both know that's impossible -- They haven't existed for a millennium. (BEAT)
What's going on here? PRIEST
.I don't know. A BEAT filled with awkward silence -- when the Priestess kti12 speaks it comes as a relief for both. An unloosenin things long held tight. PRIESTESS
Sector Seven was the only place I could find work. Waste Management. (BEAT)
Nobody else would hire me. %No applicable skills.& PRIEST
I heard that one too. PRIESTESS
A week ago, a family camping out on the Perimeter approached me --.Told me vampires were terrorizing their village and that the government wouldn't do anything about it. PRIEST
Did you go to The Clergy? PRIESTESS
They wouldn't see me, (LOOKS DOWN) (MORE)
PRIESTESS (CONT'D)
By the time I got to the village it was completely razed. Nothing left. Women. Children. All dead ...they didn't even bother to feed. (BEAT)
I've been on their trail ever since...could be the same group who took your niece. PRIEST
Could be. The Priestess glances towards Hicks. PRIESTESS
Does the lawman know what you'll do if you find her? PRIEST
He knows. PRIESTESS
He'll try to stop you. PRIEST
He won't be able to. She pauses a moment, regarding him. PRIESTESS
You know, some nights I still dream we're back on the frontlines ... I wake up, I'm sweating... my muscles all clenched like I'm ready for something -- But I don't know what. PRIEST
Me too. PRIESTESS
Nights like that ...I don't go back to sleep. (BEAT)
But on other nights ...the good nights I dream about other things. PRIEST
..Like what? PRIESTESS
You. Priest stares at her, not sure what to say. Lucky for him the moment gets interrupted by -- 65. HICKS
(shouting from below) - Hey.you guys better get a look at thisl The warriors lock eyes, knowing something's been started but.unsure of what. They head down the stone steps. CUT TO:

it must be a birthmark of some kind. HICKS
That ain't no birthmark -- it's a brand. The Priestess studies the mark, something about it making skin crawl. Maybe because it's in'theshape of a top hat. PRIESTESS
There's something else you need to see... CUT TO:
Carrying a torch, the Priestess. leads Priest and Hicks through the maze, the deeper they go the more subterranea feels. Bowels of the earth. PRIESTESS
I found this just before I was attacked -

Huge. Cavernous. Our group appearing as tiny shapes set against the awesome scale of the place. Hundreds of LARGE HOLES gouged into the walls, stretching as far as torchli allows. An incredible sight. PRIEST
It's a tomb. Big enough for an army. HICKS
Guess they're not as endangered as everyone thought. (MORE)
(BEAT)
0 But where'd they go?. We hear a LOUD SHRIEK - and a MASSIVE SWARM OF BATS sweep through the depths of the chamber, black wings fluttering PRIEST
Only one way to find out...

Our group moving deeper into the dark cavern, a moan of w echoing off the gorge wail behind them, massive black stalactites hanging overhead. Very creepy. They move quickly, Priest ahead of the other two. Hicks gazes at the Priestess, admiring her body. Any man would. He works up his courage and approaches her. Quietly. HICKS
Are Priests allowed to, you know...have relations? PRIESTESS
We take a vow of celibacy at inception. Hicks can't be sure -- did she just look at Priest when s said that? HICKS
Look...I was uh, wondering --. how did he do that little stunt back there? PRIESTESS
All Priests can do it. HICKS
Including you? She nods. HICKS (CONT'D)
So what's the trick? PRIESTESS
No trick. You just have to remember. HICKS
Remember... what? PRIESTESS
Time is relative. 67. Priest snaps up his hand, cutting off their conversation, something strange up ahead -- He slowly moves forward, th tunnel sharply dropping, feeding into a -- HUGE CHAMBER
Not like the cave, this is more earthen. Like the inside wasp nest, curved walls made of dirt and spit, Priest cov his nose and mouth as he's hit with a massive stench.

Looms before him, we_don't see what it is. As the Priestess and Hicks enter the chamber, Hicks cough reeling from the smell, the Priestess wrapping a cloth ar her mouth -- the CAMERA focusing only on theirexpressions they take in the horrible spectacle before them. PRIEST
You said the next nearest town was Jericho. HICKS
Yeah. PRIEST
Then we better go see. HICKS
. See what? PRIESTESS
-- What they left of it. PUSH IN ON HICKS -- knots of rope tightening in his stomach... only now realizing how truly black the path be him will be. CUT TO:
The NIGHT TRAIN thundering across the rails, almost obsce in the bright sunlight. An intruder from the darkness We hear a SCRATCHING sound, something scraping. Heavy breathing as we MOVE INTO...

Hey... The Familiar turns -- Lucy's perched inside one of the JO lining the underside of the train. KRACKI- She lets loose with a well-placed KICK, snapping head back so he catches on the track. With ascream, he's quickly SUCKED out the train, pulverized on the track. Lucy's covers her mouth, her nails an ugly bloody mass. She's come this far, time to go the rest. Catching herself just in time. Her eyelids practically brushing the wood. Taking a deep breath, she manages to hoist herself throug the rest of the way finally making it to the CABOOSE. She pulls herself up onto the back of the car. Now what? train is blazing past the wasteland at an incredible spee Only one thing to do. She makes the sign of the cross, closes her eyes and JUMP

A dustorm. The plain's a shifting veil of sand, parting to reveal a vista of dunes, wind shipping across them. 69. As quickly as it opened the veil closes again, shifting t reveal OUR TRIO plowing through, blast goggles and respirators covering their faces. The Priestess riding a cycle identical to Priest's. In the distance we can make out a cluster of structures a they arrive at Jericho.

Riding into town. The storm making it difficult to see anything as they idle onto main street. It's deserted -- only sound a saloon door creaking noisily in the wind. Ominous signs left in the vampires' wake are everywhere - BROKEN DOORS, SHATTERED WINDOWS, OVERTURNED VEHICLES. PRIEST
We separate. Go through each building, see what we find. HICKS
I'll start with the sheriff. PRIESTESS
Be careful. Just because it's daylight doesn't mean it's safe. Hicks nods, tightening the twin BANDOLEERS across his che

Everything is eerily quiet, just the sound of the wind. Hicks crouches just outside the door, examining SPENT SHE CASINGS littering the walkway. He pulls out his six-shoot pushing the door open with his gun, stepping inside --
The place is a mess. DUST BLOWN IN FROM THE STORM COVERS EVERYTHING, broken furniture scattered everywhere, glass littering the floor Whatever went down here -- someone put up a hell of a fig HICKS
'Damn. He shakes his head, heading towards the holding area as - 70.

The Priestess walks in, flurries of yellow dust swirling her wake, filling the room. if the jail was a disaster zone, this place is just plain creepy. Red sofas, red curtains, hell, even red wine. Everything set up for a great time...just no people. A PIANO sits nestled in the corner, she walks to it and r her finger across the dust covered keys. It comes up wet and red. Blood.

head_text.subj: MUSIC SUDDENLY BURSTS FROM THE PIANO

text: The plinking keys playing by themselves, activated by pneumatic pegs on a rotating paper roll, filling the lone room with tin-pan music.

The sound of a record skipping. Priest steps through a doorway, the door already ripped o its hinges. Broken furniture and glass. It's obvious a FAMILY lived here, children's clothes and wooden toys messily strewn across the floor. He walks to an OLD PHONOGRAPH sitting on the windowsill, still playing, placing the needle back in its cradle. That's when so=thing out the window ratchgo hiseve...
Hicks, done searching, meets up with the Priestess in the middle of the street, he's pretty disturbed. Wind howling around him. HICKS
There ain't nobody left. Nobody. PRIESTESS (OMINOUS)
Too many mouths to feed. HICKS
Where's Priest? 71. But the Priestess's already focused on something else, ga at something behind the general store. He turns to see wh it is. PRIEST
On the ground KNEELING. Head down, engaging in some kind prayer. THE CAMERA FOLLOWS as they slowly approach, wondering wha the hell is going on. As they get closer they see the ful PICTURE:

Before Priest are THREE LARGE WOODEN CROSSES, A NAKED BOD EACH, crucified. Because of the swirling sand it's hard t make out their faces but it's obvious the poor souls are already dead. Immediately the Priestess drops beside Priest, joining hi And it is only now that we get a good look at the crucifi FACES
They're Priests. CUT TO:
Bare feet running on the salt-flats. It's Lucy. Covered in dirt, battered and bruised but chugging along. There is absolutely NOTHING out here, onl LUCY AND
